property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: Map showing the location of Pakistan

note.text: Because of its strategic location in South Asia linking western Asia and India, Pakistan has long been a trade center. However, this has also made it historically subject to conquest.
Pakistan is bordered by the Arabian Sea to the south, Iran to the west, Afghanistan to the northwest, China to the northeast, and India to the east.
The country has an area of about 307,000 square miles, which makes it roughly twice the size of California.
